title: Kamala Harris would get us into World War III: Donald Trump
content: As the US presidential elections near, Donald Trump accuses Kamala Harris of being incapable of leadership and argues she would lead the US into World War III. Meanwhile, Michelle Obama defends Harris, criticizing a double standard in scrutiny and highlighting Trump's past behavior and legal issues.
summary: As the US presidential elections near, Donald Trump accuses Kamala Harris of being incapable of leadership and argues she would lead the US into World War III. Meanwhile, Michelle Obama defends Harris, criticizing a double standard in scrutiny and highlighting Trump's past behavior and legal issues.

title: Oil prices likely to fall after Israel shows restraint in strikes on Iran
content: Oil prices are predicted to fall as Israel's strike on Iran over the weekend avoided key oil and nuclear sites, ensuring no disruption to energy supplies. Israeli jets targeted missile factories, easing market concerns. Analysts expect a temporary dip in prices, with Brent crude potentially dropping to $74-$75 a barrel.
summary: Oil prices are predicted to fall as Israel's strike on Iran over the weekend avoided key oil and nuclear sites, ensuring no disruption to energy supplies. Israeli jets targeted missile factories, easing market concerns. Analysts expect a temporary dip in prices, with Brent crude potentially dropping to $74-$75 a barrel.

title: Trump or Harris: Who is Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu likely to support?
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu is hopeful for Trump’s return to the presidency, expecting beneficial policies for Israel despite Trump's mixed messages. Analysts suggest a Trump victory would provide Netanyahu greater freedom, contrasting Biden's more critical stance. Meanwhile, Palestinians remain skeptical of both candidates.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu is hopeful for Trump’s return to the presidency, expecting beneficial policies for Israel despite Trump's mixed messages. Analysts suggest a Trump victory would provide Netanyahu greater freedom, contrasting Biden's more critical stance. Meanwhile, Palestinians remain skeptical of both candidates.

title: Uzbekistan set to elect parliament loyal to president
content: Uzbekistan holds a parliamentary election with all participating parties supporting President Shavkat Mirziyoyev. Due to the lack of opposition, the new parliament will likely remain loyal to Mirziyoyev. Significant changes include a mixed election system and heightened legislative activity concerning foreign relations, particularly with Russia.
summary: Uzbekistan holds a parliamentary election with all participating parties supporting President Shavkat Mirziyoyev. Due to the lack of opposition, the new parliament will likely remain loyal to Mirziyoyev. Significant changes include a mixed election system and heightened legislative activity concerning foreign relations, particularly with Russia.

title: Trump bowls a Google-y, says Pichai called to compliment his McD sortie
content: Donald Trump claims that Google CEO Sundar Pichai called him to praise his visit to McDonald's, labeling it a significant event. Trump has made similar claims about calls from Apple’s Tim Cook and META’s Mark Zuckerberg, though these figures haven't confirmed such interactions. Trump's supporters believe these claims indicate his potential election success.
summary: Donald Trump claims that Google CEO Sundar Pichai called him to praise his visit to McDonald's, labeling it a significant event. Trump has made similar claims about calls from Apple’s Tim Cook and META’s Mark Zuckerberg, though these figures haven't confirmed such interactions. Trump's supporters believe these claims indicate his potential election success.

title: China vows 'countermeasures' over $2 billion US arms deal with Taiwan
content: China has strongly condemned the US's approval of a $2 billion arms sale to Taiwan, promising countermeasures to defend its sovereignty. The Pentagon's package includes an advanced missile system used in Ukraine. China urges the US to halt such actions to maintain peace, while Taiwan asserts its right to defend itself.
summary: China has strongly condemned the US's approval of a $2 billion arms sale to Taiwan, promising countermeasures to defend its sovereignty. The Pentagon's package includes an advanced missile system used in Ukraine. China urges the US to halt such actions to maintain peace, while Taiwan asserts its right to defend itself.

title: Tropical storm Trami leaves 126 dead or missing amid massive flooding and landslides in Philippines
content: Tropical Storm Trami has wreaked havoc in the Philippines, leaving at least 85 dead and 41 missing. President Ferdinand Marcos acknowledged ongoing rescue efforts, especially in flooded and isolated areas. With over 5 million people affected, the government plans a major flood control project to combat the unprecedented climate threats.
summary: Tropical Storm Trami has wreaked havoc in the Philippines, leaving at least 85 dead and 41 missing. President Ferdinand Marcos acknowledged ongoing rescue efforts, especially in flooded and isolated areas. With over 5 million people affected, the government plans a major flood control project to combat the unprecedented climate threats.

title: Photo of Kamala Harris in McDonald's dress going viral. Is it real?
content: ​McDonald's said it is true that no records of Harris' employment exist but this is not an aberration and not a reason to think that she didn't work at a McDonald's. "Though we are not a political brand, we’ve been proud to hear former President Trump’s love for McDonald’s and Vice President Harris’s fond memories working under the Arches. While we and our franchisees don’t have records for all positions dating back to the early ’80s, what makes ‘1 in 8’ so powerful is the shared experience so many Americans have had."
summary: ​McDonald's said it is true that no records of Harris' employment exist but this is not an aberration and not a reason to think that she didn't work at a McDonald's. "Though we are not a political brand, we’ve been proud to hear former President Trump’s love for McDonald’s and Vice President Harris’s fond memories working under the Arches. While we and our franchisees don’t have records for all positions dating back to the early ’80s, what makes ‘1 in 8’ so powerful is the shared experience so many Americans have had."

title: Amber Rose says Beyonce's Kamala Harris speech is copied. Social media users ask 'Who are you?'
content: ​Amber Rose stirred a social media frenzy after she claimed the Beyonce's speech for Kamala Harris on Friday was copied from the speech that Amber Rose gave for Donald Trump at the Republican National Convention. "She wanna be me so bad. Literally took my whole speech," Amber Rose's comment went viral with people questioning why Beyonce would even try to copy Amber Rose. Social media users also questioned who Amber Rose is and who on earth wants to be Amber Rose.
summary: ​Amber Rose stirred a social media frenzy after she claimed the Beyonce's speech for Kamala Harris on Friday was copied from the speech that Amber Rose gave for Donald Trump at the Republican National Convention. "She wanna be me so bad. Literally took my whole speech," Amber Rose's comment went viral with people questioning why Beyonce would even try to copy Amber Rose. Social media users also questioned who Amber Rose is and who on earth wants to be Amber Rose.

title: World leaders call for de-escalation
content: The US, Britain, and the EU call for de-escalation as Israel hits military targets across Iran in retaliatory strikes. UN chief Antonio Guterres urges an end to the conflict. Israel's actions were described as self-defense, while Russia and various Muslim countries condemned the strikes and warned of further escalation in the Middle East.
summary: The US, Britain, and the EU call for de-escalation as Israel hits military targets across Iran in retaliatory strikes. UN chief Antonio Guterres urges an end to the conflict. Israel's actions were described as self-defense, while Russia and various Muslim countries condemned the strikes and warned of further escalation in the Middle East.

title: Jamaat backs calls for Bangladesh president's resignation
content: Demands for the Bangladesh president's resignation are growing, as key organizations like the Anti-Discrimination Student Movement and Jatiya Nagorik Committee met with senior BNP leaders. They also discussed the idea of a 'second republic,' proposed by Jamaat, aiming to build political consensus on these issues. BNP will evaluate the demands within their party forum.
summary: Demands for the Bangladesh president's resignation are growing, as key organizations like the Anti-Discrimination Student Movement and Jatiya Nagorik Committee met with senior BNP leaders. They also discussed the idea of a 'second republic,' proposed by Jamaat, aiming to build political consensus on these issues. BNP will evaluate the demands within their party forum.

title: US approves $2 billion in arms sales to Taiwan
content: The US approved a $2 billion arms sale to Taiwan, including advanced surface-to-air missile systems, amid rising tensions with China. Taiwan's president thanked the US, citing the need for stronger self-defense capabilities. The sales include NASAMS and radar systems to bolster Taiwan's military.
summary: The US approved a $2 billion arms sale to Taiwan, including advanced surface-to-air missile systems, amid rising tensions with China. Taiwan's president thanked the US, citing the need for stronger self-defense capabilities. The sales include NASAMS and radar systems to bolster Taiwan's military.

title: Ukraine invasion biggest threat to world peace: Olaf Scholz
content: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz emphasized the importance of maintaining existing borders and condemned aggression, referring to the Russia-Ukraine conflict as the greatest current threat to international peace. During his three-day visit to India, Scholz engaged with students at BITS Pilani in Goa and highlighted the significance of safe seas and freedom of navigation.
summary: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz emphasized the importance of maintaining existing borders and condemned aggression, referring to the Russia-Ukraine conflict as the greatest current threat to international peace. During his three-day visit to India, Scholz engaged with students at BITS Pilani in Goa and highlighted the significance of safe seas and freedom of navigation.

title: End of road for Chinese investors in Bordeaux wine
content: Many Chinese investors are selling their Bordeaux wine estates due to capital controls in China, declining Asian demand, and underestimated operating costs. Iconic properties, including Chateau Latour Laguens, are hitting the auction block at low prices. Chinese investment in Bordeaux once fueled by dreams of luxury living and high returns, now faces major setbacks.
summary: Many Chinese investors are selling their Bordeaux wine estates due to capital controls in China, declining Asian demand, and underestimated operating costs. Iconic properties, including Chateau Latour Laguens, are hitting the auction block at low prices. Chinese investment in Bordeaux once fueled by dreams of luxury living and high returns, now faces major setbacks.

title: Are Musk & Russian President Putin talking?
content: Elon Musk has been in regular contact with Russian President Vladimir Putin for the last two years, raising national security concerns due to Musk's government contracts. SpaceX's owner, also a significant supporter of Donald Trump, reportedly discussed various topics, including business and geopolitics, with Putin.
summary: Elon Musk has been in regular contact with Russian President Vladimir Putin for the last two years, raising national security concerns due to Musk's government contracts. SpaceX's owner, also a significant supporter of Donald Trump, reportedly discussed various topics, including business and geopolitics, with Putin.

title: Tel Aviv's limited attack on Tehran may help foster deal
content: Israel's Saturday assault on Iran, in coordination with Washington, targeted missile and air defense sites, aiming to de-escalate tensions in Lebanon and Gaza. The restrained strike followed consultations involving US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. Iran reported four military deaths, while US President Joe Biden noted the precision targeting of military installations.
summary: Israel's Saturday assault on Iran, in coordination with Washington, targeted missile and air defense sites, aiming to de-escalate tensions in Lebanon and Gaza. The restrained strike followed consultations involving US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. Iran reported four military deaths, while US President Joe Biden noted the precision targeting of military installations.

title: Watch: JD Vance said he won't be shocked if Biden votes for Donald Trump
content: "He wears Trump hat at the firefighter event. A couple of weeks ago, she (Kamala Harris) was starting one of her big rallies and he (Biden) decides to have a press conference 30 seconds into it. So they're all watching Joe Biden and not Kamala Harris. Or, he'll say something nice here and there about Donald Trump," JD said.
summary: "He wears Trump hat at the firefighter event. A couple of weeks ago, she (Kamala Harris) was starting one of her big rallies and he (Biden) decides to have a press conference 30 seconds into it. So they're all watching Joe Biden and not Kamala Harris. Or, he'll say something nice here and there about Donald Trump," JD said.

title: Victoria and David Beckham are irritating to Miami neighbors: 'They are not private'
content: David and Victoria Beckham's recent $77 million mansion purchase in Miami Beach causes neighborhood disturbance due to increased media and fan attention. Unlike other celebrities, they used their real names, making their address public. Nearby residents claim that the area has been clogged with inquisitive eyes who turn up to get a glimpse of David and Victoria. And it's it's not difficult. They just look up the address in the phone book.
summary: David and Victoria Beckham's recent $77 million mansion purchase in Miami Beach causes neighborhood disturbance due to increased media and fan attention. Unlike other celebrities, they used their real names, making their address public. Nearby residents claim that the area has been clogged with inquisitive eyes who turn up to get a glimpse of David and Victoria. And it's it's not difficult. They just look up the address in the phone book.

title: Amid 'boycott Amazon' trend, Trump meets executives of Bezos-owned Blue Origin
content: ​A lot of unconfirmed inside information is floating around after the WaPo announced its decision to not endorse either Kamala Harris or Donald Trump this election.. According to one report, an endorsement of Harris was drafted but was not published as the go-ahead from Bezos was awaited. The decision not to publish that endorsement was made by Bezos alone.
summary: ​A lot of unconfirmed inside information is floating around after the WaPo announced its decision to not endorse either Kamala Harris or Donald Trump this election.. According to one report, an endorsement of Harris was drafted but was not published as the go-ahead from Bezos was awaited. The decision not to publish that endorsement was made by Bezos alone.

title: 'Barron knows all about you': Is Donald Trump obsessed with his 18-year-old son?
content: Donald Trump said podcasts, TikTok are a whole new world to him and he is now on TikTok. "Barron knows all about you. He knows guys I have never heard of like Adin Ross. I'd say who are they and he would say they are very big. You gotta do it. He's very smart," Donald Trump said.
summary: Donald Trump said podcasts, TikTok are a whole new world to him and he is now on TikTok. "Barron knows all about you. He knows guys I have never heard of like Adin Ross. I'd say who are they and he would say they are very big. You gotta do it. He's very smart," Donald Trump said.
